synopsis.text:
Hyojuâ€™s life takes a turn when Gon, a mischievous orphaned fox, steals his eel, leaving Hyoju's ailing mother without a meal. Overwhelmed with guilt after her passing, Gon embarks on a secret mission to make amends. Every day, he leaves small tokens of kindness at Hyoju's doorstep, hoping to ease the boy's pain. In return, Hyoju places a red spider lily as a token of gratitude, unaware of the true identity of his mysterious benefactor.

Based on Niimi Nankichi's renowned work, 'Gon, the Little Fox', this poignant tale unfolds in the serene beauty of a Japanese village surrounded by lush woodlands. The story delicately explores the unbridgeable chasm between human and animal, as Gon and Hyoju unknowingly forge a bond that leads to an emotional climax. This heartwarming yet melancholic narrative will captivate your heart and leave you pondering the invisible connections that bind us all.
